data.description: DormWatch is a mobile app which allows users (such as foreign workers), to report on defects, broken facilities/ equipment directly to the dormitory operator. The app aims to encourage operators to self-regulate and fix the issues identified by users. It also tracks, monitors and alerts parties of that latest status updates. MOM will also be kept informed on the progress of the issues identified; MOM would be able to step in and inspect the premises, if deemed necessary.

This application is jointly developed by Ministry of Manpower (MOM) and Workplace Safety and Health Council (WSHC).
SnapSAFE is a free mobile app that allows the public to report workplace safety and health issues in Singapore. 
Use SnapSAFE app to 
-- Report workplace safety and health lapses to Ministry of Manpower and the occupier
-- Report workplace safety and health lapses within your company. The information will not be sent to Ministry of Manpower

This app is previously known as Snap@MOM.

Developed by the SingHealth Group, Health Buddy gives you access to health information and services, anytime, anywhere. Through this app, SingHealth hopes to encourage active involvement in one’s own health and well-being. 

Features:

• Mobile appointments
Manage all your appointments

• Clinic Queue Updates 
Get your queue number and monitor queue status from your phone.

• Mobile Pay
Leave the clinic after seeing the doctor and receive SMS to pay at the end of the day.

• Medicine Top-Up
Arrange to pick up your medicine or request for a repeat prescription.

• Conditions & Treatments 
Access over 800 conditions and treatments written by our SingHealth doctors.

• SingHealth Doctors
Access over 1,000 internationally qualified SingHealth doctors for your treatment needs.

• Hospitals & Specialty Centres
Find contact information, directions, visit guides and more!

• Health Tips by HealthXchange.sg
Stay healthy with useful and trusted health tips from our doctors.

• Health Videos
Browse library of videos as seen in our clinic waiting areas.

• Find a GP  
Find contact information and opening hours of GP / Family Doctors in Singapore.

• Caregiver [NEW!] 
Get authorised to conveniently help manage your loved ones’ medical matters.

• Personal Profile
View and update your contact information.

• My Visit [NEW!]
Beta trial for selected SGH DMC patients. Read consultation summary, answer health questionnaires on-the-go.

• Pre- and Post-Consultation Health Questionnaires
Complete clinic health questionnaires before your visit or after your consultation, from the comfort of your home!

• Medicine Information and Reminders
View medicine information and set reminders to take your medicine.

Important:
SingHealth Appointments uses SingPass authentication for secure login.
- SingPass supports browsers Android 4.2 and above

Health Buddy app is compatible with:
- Operating System Android version 5.0 and above
- Processor: 1Ghz chipset
- Memory: 1GB RAM
myMaritime@SG - revamp version that improves user interaction and user experience.
data.developerName: Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore
data.agencyFullName: MARITIME AND PORT AUTHORITY OF SINGAPORE

data.description: BetterCarer is an e-learning app for caregivers which contains gamification features such as User Avatar, Ranking System, Daily Rewards, Mini-games, Shop, Forum and Lessons. The app encourage users to interact and share their learning experiences.

This application is a service of the Singapore Government.

Justice@State Courts mobile app provides information on the hearing dates in the State Courts and other information services such as filling instructions, virtual tour of courtrooms and access to legal aid services for the convenience of public users via its user-friendly interface. The application is available across popular mobile platforms.

Volunteers are notified via the myResponder Mobile App by SCDF’s 995 Ops Centre of any Cardiac Arrest Case within 400 metres of their location. If you are notified, you may choose to respond to the incident and offer your assistance. The Mobile App will highlight nearby AEDs that may be available. 

Once you have located the victim suffering from cardiac arrest, you can assist the original caller who alerted SCDF in performing CPR or helping to apply the AED to revive the patient. SCDF’s 995 Ops Centre may also ask responders to guide the ambulance crew by escorting them to the incident site.

If you are 15 years and above and wish to volunteer, be sure to get your SingPass ID and password ready. If you are under 18 years old, please seek parental consent for your participation. Your handphone number is also required for SCDF to get in touch with you during an emergency. 

Your response is entirely voluntary, and we only encourage you to respond when you are available and to do so within safe and reasonable means.

myResponder is the latest project by the Singapore Civil Defence Force. The myResponder Mobile App alerts volunteers to nearby Cardiac Arrest Cases to render first aid before ambulance arrival. With myResponder, volunteers will have the following services at their fingertips:

- Geolocation notification of nearby cases
- Display of nearby incidents using OneMap
- Display of nearby AEDs using OneMap
- Geolocation enabled dialling of 995
- Access to the National AED Registry

The Singapore Civil Defence Force – The Lifesaving Force

This is a mobile application of the Singapore Government.

C(SP) Interactive Resource Package is a web portal hosting digital resources for the 2015 Secondary Chinese (Special Programme) Syllabus. The content is set in localised contexts, making it highly relevant to our students’ lives. There is also a series of activities designed to reinforce students’ learning and to make learning fun and meaningful for them.

Parents Gateway is an initiative by MOE to enable parents with SingPass to interact with schools more conveniently on administrative matters. Parents will also be able to use this app to stay updated on school’s programme and activities.

The mobile app is currently only available in selected schools and will be progressively rollout to all schools subsequently. 

We appreciate if you can share with us your feedback to help MOE enhance and improve the experience, benefiting more parents in future.

[Known Issues]
- Samsung S7 on Android 6 and 7 is known to have compatibility issues. To use Parents Gateway, please upgrade to Android 8

- Enhanced security measures have been put in place for rooted devices. The security measures is known to block apps such as Lucky Patcher and Rom Manager.
Uninstalling these apps will enable you to use the Parents Gateway app.

- No or inconsistent notifications received by Oppo and Huawei devices. This is due to battery optimisation configurations set by manufacturer.

[Note]
- If you choose to log out of Parents Gateway, you will stop receiving notifications for new announcements and consent forms until your next log-in.

- Parents Gateway uses SingPass to identify parents of students in our MOE schools. SingPass is only used as an initial handshake to identify and authenticate the parent. Upon successful authentication, your sign in to Parents Gateway is granted and managed by the app itself. Connection to SingPass is henceforth terminated after the authentication process.

An active volunteer of Community Chest 公益金, Daisy together with Orange, goes on a journey to discover the joys of volunteering and helping the less fortunate. 

iVolunteers is a 2D game that consist of 3 mini games with a Story and Challenge mode. You get to understand what Community Chest 公益金 does for fund donation and how as a volunteer, you can help the less fortunate.

A collaboration between Community Chest 公益金, part of National Council of Social Service and School of Interactive & Digital Media (SIDM), Nanyang Polytechnic.

Visit as at https://www.comchest.sg

SGSecure is a national movement to sensitise, train and mobilise Singaporeans to play a part to prevent and deal with a terrorist attack..

Use the SGSecure app to: 
- Receive important broadcast messages from the authorities on the latest situation in the event of major emergencies
- Seek assistance from the authorities should a major situation happen in your vicinity
- Send videos, photos and messages to the authorities to provide information on a situation which you have witnessed
- Be alerted to any cardiac arrest or minor fire case in your vicinity
- Locate the nearest AED in your vicinity
- Be updated on security-related MFA Travel Advisories

Please note that continued use of GPS running in the background can lead to decreased battery life of your mobile device.

SGWorkPass is a free mobile app to check the validity of work passes / long term passes issued by the Singapore Ministry of Manpower (MOM).

A must have app for all employers, foreign employees, agents or anyone who wishes to verify if a work pass / long term pass card issued by MOM is valid. You will need a Singapore mobile number for a one-time registration in order to start using the app.

Scan it to check it
A work pass / long term pass may be cancelled before it expires as employment / stay status can change over time. When this happens, the pass holder is not allowed to continue working / staying in Singapore. Simply launch the SGWorkPass app to scan the QR code of a work pass / long term pass card and you can verify its validity instantly.

No QR Code? No problem!
If the work pass / long term pass card doesn’t have a QR code, you can verify it using the unique Card Serial Number printed on the card.

"The IPCP app provides you with the opportunity to learn interprofessional skills, knowledge and attitudes in a fun, interactive and immersive environment. To become an effective healthcare practitioner in a complex working environment, the ability to collaborate, communicate and problem solve with other interprofessional members is essential.

The IPCP app has been developed collboratively with educators and interprofessional team members to provide an authentic insight to working in a healthcare setting.

The app is divided to 4 units of varying difficulty from basic (Introduction of IP Team Members) to intermediate (Drug Confusion and Patient Care) to advanced (Patient Discharge) levels of interprofessional competencies."

INLIS (Integrated Land Information Service) is a one-stop portal which allows you to obtain property and land survey information such as property ownership information and survey plans provided by Singapore Land Authority. You can also obtain road line plans and railway protection plans provided by Land Transport Authority.

Police@SG is the initiative from the Singapore Police Force, which gives members of public access to useful information on the go. With Police@SG, everyone will have the following services at their fingertips:

- Read the latest crime news, police appeals for information and missing persons
- Locate the nearest police station from your current location
- Share content on Facebook and Twitter
- Links to Singapore Police Force homepage, recruitment and social media sites
- Submit information or respond to police appeals via our information submission portal "i-Witness"

The Singapore Police Force - A force for the Nation

New OneMap is the authoritative national map of Singapore with the most detailed and timely updated information developed by the Singapore Land Authority. There are also many useful day-to-day information and services contributed by government agencies.

Features of OneMap:

SEARCH: Search for addresses with postal codes and building names.

NAVIGATION: Get driving and public transport directions with walking routes.

FIND NEARBY INFORMATION: Locate nearby amenities and government information.

MAP STYLES: Select from a range of base maps.

FREE TO USE: All maps and features are free to use. No in-app purchases.
If you have any questions or feedback, please drop us an email at onemap@sla.gov.sg

Follow us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/OneMap

Embark on a transformational journey of some of our most iconic state-owned properties in Singapore! Visit the past, present and future of Tanjong Pagar Railway Station, The Grandstand, and Maxwell Chambers to learn more about them.

How to use: Use your smartphone or VR headset to immerse in the experience!

Photo Credits: Ministry of Information and the Arts (Courtesy of National Archives of Singapore), Red Dot Museum, Land Transport Authority, Ministry of Law, Maxwell Chambers, Jerome Lim (The Long and Winding Road).

Compatible with any VR headsets!

The Singapore Satellite Positioning Reference Network (SiReNT) is a national reference network infrastructure, developed to support real-time high precision Positioning, Navigation and Tracking (PNT). An initiative by Singapore Land Authority (SLA), SiReNT supports GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite System) systems such as NAVSTAR GPS, GLONASS, QZSS, Beidou and Galileo. It provides Differential GNSS (DGNSS, also known as DGPS) services which improve the accuracy and reliability of PNT.

* Please note that you will need to allow push notifications on your mobile devices to receive SiReNT Alerts and Notifications from your SiReNT Mobile App.

IMDA’s Wireless@SG application caters to the needs of people who are constantly on the move.

IMDA’s revamp of the application features an improved user interface and new functions.

Through this app, you can:
- Set up your device to automatically connect to the Wireless@SGx network
- Locate Wireless@SG hotspots via an interactive map
- Run speed tests and diagnostics that can help improve network experience
- Receive important updates for Wireless@SG

To prevent potential conflict, please UNINSTALL the older version of Wireless@SG application and delete all previous Wireless@SGx profiles.

Data charges may be incurred if using this application on a paid connection such as mobile data.

MSS’ Weather@SG provides the latest warnings, forecasts and observations at your fingertips. Through this app, users can:
• Receive warnings of heavy rain and other hazards
• Access weather forecasts
• View real-time weather observations 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

For a full suite of weather information, please visit http://www.weather.gov.sg or follow MetServiceSG on Twitter to receive more updates.

The Meteorological Service Singapore (MSS) is Singapore’s national authority on the weather and climate. It is an operations division under the National Environment Agency (NEA).
Our mission is to observe and understand the weather and climate affecting Singapore and to provide services in support of national needs and international co-operation. The key areas within the mission include:
• Collecting and maintaining of reliable long-term national weather records
• Providing reliable weather and climate services
• Conducting high quality research to advance understanding and prediction of the weather and climate of Singapore and the region
• Performing risk and impact assessment of natural environmental hazards

This application is a service of the Singapore government.

CEA@SG features the CEA Public Register and Consumer Resources to help consumers make informed decisions in their property transactions. 

The CEA Public Register is a free m-service that enables consumers to:
- Check whether a real estate agent is licensed by CEA.
- Check whether a salesperson is registered with CEA.
- Know whether a real estate agent or salesperson has been disciplined by CEA within the last three years.
- Know whether any awards have been conferred on a real estate agent or salesperson by CEA.

The Consumer Resources you can access on this app include CEA’s Consumer Guides, Press Releases and CEAnergy e-Newsletter.

The Council for Estate Agencies (CEA) is the regulator of the real estate agency industry in Singapore and a statutory board under the Ministry of National Development.
Your RED Camp journey starts here! Get all the deets on the most lit camp for O-levelers!
NP Attendance allows the NP community to mark attendance for events/activities organised by Ngee Ann Polytechnic.
Container listing common NP web applications and mobile apps for the NP community.

Single-Player, 2 Level, Virtual Hospital Game designed for nursing students and nurses to simulate a real hospital environment. This game is designed around 12 major diseases which allows the player to apply critical thinking skills in an interactive game.
This app belongs to Ngee Ann Polytechnic.
data.developerName: School of Engineering, Ngee Ann Polytechnic

data.description:
Due to dementia, some elderlies are not able to find their way home after they leave home alone. 

This solution proposes to tag dementia elderlies with Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) beacons. When an elderly user is reported missing, this app will automatically monitoring for his beacons in the background. It reports any detection to server and then to caregivers. More volunteers are needed for this app to be effective.
data.developerName: School of Engineering, Ngee Ann Polytechnic

data.description: Singapore is a multiracial country with a population made up of Chinese,Malays,Indians and other races. To bridge this communication gap between the races and dialects used by the population at large and the nursing students, a database with audio capability of commonly used phrases by nurses, are made available in Mandarin, Hokkien and Cantonese dialects as well as Malay.

This app is an educational tool that acts as both a reference and a self-assessment tool for skeletal bones and joint movements.

The app consists of 5 different bone sets:
• cranial bones 
• upper limb
• lower limb
• facial
• axial skeleton

Users can:
• browse the reference section to learn about the bone groups
• try assembling each bone group from constituent bones, then name them
• test themselves on correct joint movements using the accelerometer (e.g. abduction at left shoulder)

Points are awarded for correctly joining the bones to form a bone group as well as correct movement of the joint.

This app is developed for the School of Health Sciences, Ngee Ann Polytechnic. For more information, please contact sch_hs@np.edu.sg.

Virtual Hospital 2 can be played as both single-user and multi-user game. It is developed for Year 2 and Year 3 Nursing students at the School of Health Sciences, Ngee Ann Polytechnic. The game-based, learner-centered approach empowers students to build on knowledge learnt in the Nursing Science modules. In the multi-player mode, students are involved in collaborative learning as they work as a team to solve problems.

The game depicts real-life scenarios showing different types of patients with different clinical conditions. In the game, the students are trained in various skills, such as nursing care and management of patients. They are required to demonstrate competence in caring for patients with various clinical conditions. Every appropriate nursing interventions lead to gaining points and progression in the game.

The app. is also a good tool to help the students develop clinical judgment, clinical reasoning and critical thinking skills through real-life scenarios.

Given the list of medical abbreviations widely used in the healthcare context, this apps allows nursing students to seek answers to those mind-boggling abbreviations scribbled in medical documents. These medical abbreviations are arranged in alphabetical order allowing user to search for the abbreviations and its definitions quickly.

NP Wellbeing Attendance App is to allow NP staff to mark their wellbeing activities attendance via their mobile device. This service is offered to NP staff using Android and iOS mobile devices with Internet access.

The New NPalm Nursing Assessment app is the first-of-its-kind mobile nursing assessment programme in Asia. Updated to HTML 5 with auto synchronize to backend database. The app allows NP students to conduct MCQ-type self assessment, update learning journals and also allows Clinical Facilitators (CF) and Clinical Instructors (CI) to securely record/sign skill items performed during the clinical attachments. Lecturers are also able to view records created by students under their charge.

The individual sub-apps are:
1. Pre-test
2. E-LogBook
3. Learning Journal.

The app has 2 sections; Coronary Circulation and Electrocardiogram. Each section is developed into 3 levels of learning processes. The contents of the levels are designed with Bloom Taxonomy from the basic anatomy & physiology to the mechanism of disease processes and the diagnosis & management of cardiovascular diseases.

BusyMissy is a single user self-learning nursing skills centric game which aims to help nursing students learn the nursing skills in a fun, interactive and engaging manner. The game also aims to make learning more meaningful by integrated knowledge and practice within clinical scenarios. Within the game, a scenario or patient background will be presented to the player. The player has to ask or answer the right questions and perform the right task as he/she progress through the storyboard. The game illustrates the admission, hospitalization and discharge of a patient. During admission & hospitalization, there are activities to assess the students’ assessment, diagnosing, planning, implementation, evaluation and documentation skills.

"The RESUS App is developed for nursing students at the School of Health Sciences, Ngee Ann Polytechnic. It is the simple and fast way to help students to learn and test them on the correct CPR techniques and processes. Also, it is the good way to augment learning in emergency and critical care nursing.

RESUS App comprises of the following sub-modules:
• BCLS (4 modules)
1. One man adult CPR 
2. Relief of adult foreign body airway obstruction (FBAO)
3. Infant one-rescuer CPR
4. Relief of infant foreign body airway obstruction (FBAO)
• BCLS + AED instructor course
• Megacode
• AED

RESUS App allows the users to simulate cardiac compression and ventilation. It incorporate a metronome to simulate cardiac compressions for deliverance of 100 beats per minutes.

A question bank with appropriate taxonomy levels is set up for students to perform self-assessment on the theoretical contents covered in the modules.

RESUS App depicts 5 real-life scenarios. It is a good tool to enable students practise life-saving decision-making skills while handling different case scenarios."

NPal2 mStaff is an extension of NPal2 Staff Self-Service which is to provide a more user-friendly experience while using essential NP e-Services. This service is offered to NP staff using Android and iOS mobile devices with Internet access.

NPal2 mStudent is an extension of NPal2 Student Self-Service, providing more personalised experience while using essential e-Services. This service is offered to NP students on mobile devices with Internet access.

Your feedback is important to us. Features available in the app are a result of your feedback. So do continue to give us your feedback via 'Contact us / Feedback' in the app.

Alert@NP is an app for Ngee Ann Polytechnic's staff, students and visitors to report cleanliness issues, defects, hazards and near misses. 

All you have to do is to notify us on incidents of water and energy wastage, building defects, unauthorised smoking, littering etc, simply by using a few taps via this app. Attach photos, add your location, description and you are good to go!

Your feedback will be kept confidential and follow-up action will be taken. 

Thank you for playing a part in keeping our environment safe and clean.

Central Quest is an interactive game which taps on iBeacon and Augmented Reality technology. Explore ITE College Central on a time-travelling adventure and complete the various challenges from different time and space! 


Features:

School of Design & Media
You are in the Land of Forgotten. Capture flying dinosaurs to lift your spaceship from the swamp.

School of Electronics & Info-Comm Technology
You are teleported into a new millennium where you face an alien attack. 

School of Business & Services
You are running out of fuel for your journey home. Collect coins to accumulate the amount required to purchase the fuel.

School of Engineering
Your spaceship is damaged during an attack and you need to get supplies from the helicopter before the pirate jet planes destroy them.
This app enables the user to experience AR content and watch video on eCookbook release. User also can take a Selfie or Wefie with the mobile device through the app.
A VR app featuring garden at ITE College Central
There are few games for kids to learn and play, the player can find out the game's instruction in the apps.

AR Prototyping is an app that helps beginner 3D modeller to visualise how are UV maps being mapped on to a 3D model.

Users will be able to see their changes in real time while they colour the printed UV map therefore enabling them to relate to how things are mapped.

Users may download the following templates below:
https://goo.gl/HDF5zJ
360° views of ITE College Central Singapore, School of Electronics & Info-Comm Technology (SEIT). 360 images cover the various facilities from SEIT where students hands-on, minds-on and hearts-on.
This AR is for kids to play with the animals that can't be brought into the classroom. They can also learn about their foods.

A collaboration between Community Chest and the School of Interactive & Digital Media (SIDM), Nanyang Polytechnic.

From 20 - 27 May 2018, The Future We Create – visualisation app will capture and showcase ‘live’ updates of the total donation amount collected for the Community Chest Charity TV Show 2018. Creatively designed with day and night animated visuals that match the time of day, the app is an example of how students have leveraged technology to do their bit for charity and give back to the community.

Find out more about the Community Chest and the Charity TV Show 2018 at comchest.sg.

An arcade style game about scoring recyclable trash into recycling bins. Unlock more recyclables as you play! 

A short game demo by Terence Sim from School of Interactive & Digital Media, NYP
Special thanks to NYP, Ms Tan Siew Lan, Ho Xin En, Romanda Goh, Joylyn Tan Yong Ying
https://www.playonloop.com/2018-music-loops/azure-waters/
Background music by PlayOnLoop.com
Licensed under Creative Commons by Attribution 4.0

Any person who wishes to apply for CAAS pilot or air traffic controller licence is required to have a valid Medical Assessment of the relevant class. This application provides the updated list of Designated Medical Examiners (DMEs) who are able to perform the relevant Licensing Medical Examination and Aeromedical Review for applicants or licence holders. Information provided by this application includes clinic location, onsite investigation facilities, contact number and contact email of each of the DMEs.

NYP Connect is a free mobile application developed for NYP alumni only. Download the app and install your NYP e-Card on your smartphone! With the e‐Card, you will be able to view and register for upcoming alumni events, book NYP sport and recreational facilities, access the Library and Reading Lounge, and update your particulars on the go! With the e-Card, Diploma graduates can also request for transcripts and exchange contact info with your NYP alumni-friends when you meet.

Developed by the NYP School of IT, the NYP Connect e‐Card is YOUR NYP identity!

This application is a service of the Singapore Government.

Get access to news releases, vessel information/alerts and other e-services with myMaritime@SG:
• News releases and circulars
• Real time information of a vessel details
• Latest vessel arrival/departure schedule
• Daily shipping state list of vessels
• Receive alert when a vessel arrives, departs, or moves from one location to another within Singapore Port
• Report unusual or illegal activities in port waters via Feedback
• Tidal Atlas
• And many more e-services to come in future updates...

Note: The m-Marinet module requires users to have a valid MARINET login ID to access. For more information on MARINET, please visit http://www.mpa.gov.sg/sites/global_navigation/e-services/e_services.page.

The Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore (MPA) was established on 2 February 1996, with the mission to develop Singapore as a premier global hub port and International Maritime Centre (IMC), and to advance and safeguard Singapore's strategic maritime interests. MPA is the driving force behind Singapore's port and maritime development, taking on the roles of Port Authority, Port Regulator, Port Planner, IMC Champion, and National Maritime Representative. MPA partners the industry and other agencies to enhance safety, security and environmental protection in Singapore port waters, facilitate port operations and growth, expand the cluster of maritime ancillary services, and promote maritime R&D and manpower development.
data.developerName: Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore
data.agencyFullName: MARITIME AND PORT AUTHORITY OF SINGAPORE

data.description: HelpBuddy is a mobile app jointly developed by the Singapore Management University (SMU) and the Municipal Services Office (MSO) that aims to encourage residents to take ownership of their living environment, facilitate volunteerism and community participation. The app would recommend activities to users based on user’s preferences, task history and physical proximity to activity’s location. The data collated would help to support behavioural research and allow SMU researchers and Government agencies to understand the users’ attitudes and behaviours towards this new concept

NYP Mobile is the official mobile app designed for Nanyang Poly’s students and staff. Designed to enhance the experience of our community, it offers access to commonly used E-Services directly from the phone or tablet. Navigate NYP on the go and see the rich campus life through info and events. Users will also be able to view all full-time and part-time courses offered by the polytechnic.

NYP Mobile allows you to:
- See how crowded canteens and library study spaces are
- Check how crowded the i@Central help desk is
- Get a campus map, learn how to get to NYP, and find out about bus arrival timings at nearby bus stops
- Find contact information in the staff directory
- Receive Info Alerts 
- Check out the facilities and food outlets available
- Students can check timetable and exam results
- Staff can apply for annual leave

This application is a service of the Singapore Government.

The "OneService" mobile application is part of the Government’s on-going efforts to provide a convenient channel for reporting municipal issues within Singapore. The application provides for common categories of municipal issues and more features will be offered under subsequent updates.

Date of Official Launch: 25 January 2015

To provide feedback on the application, please e-mail us at mso_appenquiry@mnd.gov.sg

Stay informed about events organised by SingHealth with the SingHealth Event App! 

With this app, you can view all SingHealth events and details like programme/schedule, speakers' biography, event venue and more in one place. You can also choose to receive notifications and alerts from organisers, participate in event polls and surveys.

If you have any question regarding the use of the SingHealth Event App, please contact emp.helpdesk@singhealthacademy.edu.sg

Produced by KK Women's and Children's Hospital in Singapore, the Woman&Child HealthPedia app is an expert health guide and companion through your journey in pregnancy and parenthood! Get to know week-by-week pregnancy milestones and useful tips, for both mother and baby. Personalise the content by keying in your Last Menstruation Date, Estimated Delivery Date and/or Gestation Period. This free app also provides a comprehensive health library relating to women and children with guidance from specialist doctors at your fingertips. The latest version of the app includes a pregnancy and baby journal to help you record those treasured moments during your pregnancy and as you watch your baby grow. Learn more about the developmental milestones and set reminders so you don’t miss the important vaccinations for your baby!

This is an interactive ECG teaching app designed by cardiologists to help teach the clinical pearls of ECG interpretation to doctors, healthcare professionals and students.

This app includes many case-based examples, quizzes and tips and tricks that will help in the learning process.

This app has been endorsed by several major cardiology societies.

This app is for HDB staff’s use only.

The key features of this app include:

Monitoring your health statistics
· Keep track of your height, weight, BMI and calories burnt
· Set your daily steps goal and track your daily steps count

Location & Information on HDB Panel Clinics
· Locate and view the details of HDB Panel Clinics

Push Notifications on HDB health and wellness activities
· Receive notifications on upcoming health activities organised for HDB staff

Health-related Information
· View guidelines and articles on Workplace Safety & Health
· Access related agencies’ websites on health and Workplace Safety information

We’ve refreshed our website and mobile app to bring you a brand new experience. 

You can continue to access our whole range of services at your convenience:

* Check your sales application results, the BTO flats available for selection, and their probable completion dates

* View the recent transacted prices of resale flats and the ethnic quotas, at the location of your choice

* Locate and find your way to HDB Hub, Branch, and Service Centres

The Housing & Development Board (HDB) is Singapore's public housing authority and a statutory board under the Ministry of National Development.

Note:
* Selected services may require you to use SingPass or eNETS to complete the transaction.
* This application is a service of the Singapore Government.

Curated by the National Archives of Singapore, the application leads visitors through the historic
Former Ford Factory’s permanent World War Two exhibition via an interactive guide.
The Former Ford Factory was the place where the British forces in Singapore surrendered to the
Imperial Japanese Army on 15 February 1942.
The application supplements the exhibition and enhances the overall user experience through oral
history accounts, archival material, exclusive video content via QR code scanning and Augmented
Reality (AR) features.
Check out the exhibition at: www.nas.gov.sg/formerfordfactory

This application is a service of Singapore Government.

A new version of NLB Mobile with new nifty features.

Provided by the National Library Board Singapore, the application allows library patrons to:

• Set up multiple user profiles
• Borrow library items by scanning barcodes 
• Manage loans and reservations
• Search the library catalogue
• View events happening at each library
• Online payment of fees
• Borrow and read ebooks in the same app
• View loan and reservation histories
• Bookmark favourite items

This game is created for SGCC 2017 organised by Nanyang Polytechnic

Follow an Eco-Knight on his journey to save the environment from harm! ECOS is a game based on the "I am an eco-knight" program in Singapore. ECOS follows the adventures of an Eco-Knight through several different planets, namely Asblik, Nyamuk and Haumia. Learn various ways of protecting the environment such as via recycling, protection from dengue, and protection of marine life. Meet various friends on the way to saving the world!
data.appName: SGCC2017 ECOS, The Guardian of the Galaxy!

data.description:
Other games give you a good time, but our game tells a story. The green city of Ecopolis is a modern day utopia, a hub of environmental research and green technology. But problems of dengue and rumours of unethical business practices threaten the city. As an expert in green technology and an investigator always standing up for environmental protection, you have been hired as an “Eco Knight”, to set things right again in Ecopolis.


You first drive a shuttle bus around the suburbs of Ecopolis, interacting with the passengers and learning more about environmental conservation and the problems plaguing Ecopolis.


Armed with this knowledge, you are asked to help eliminate the dengue problem faced by a construction company in Ecopolis, Dooduk Enterprises. There you battle the deadly aedes mosquito, to protect the lives of the residents of Ecopolis.


After successfully wiping out the mosquitos, arrive at Chatou Corp. to investigate rumours of Chatou selling inefficient appliances while forging their energy efficiency. Faced with obstacle after obstacle, will you reach the end of their production line and uncover their fraud?


Your task starts now. Delay no longer.

This game is about choosing the right type of food that is both enjoyable as well as healthy. When consuming food, the portion and the type of food is often overlooked. In this game, you will be required to prepare food for different people to allow them to eat healthily as well as to suit their preferences. Factors such as portion size and type of food are used to calculate your score.

This game is the mobile version of the game submitted by CHSION2 of Catholic High School for Singapore Games Creation Competition 2018 organised by Nanyang Polytechnic in collaboration with National Healthcare Group and ALive.

The city of Obecity is in danger! Illness has plagued the city and the only way to save it is to navigate through the city and change the lifestyles of its citizens. The power is in your hands to teach the people living in the city on the healthy-lifestyle habits! Help to advise people on the right ways to live healthily to save Obecity and conquer all the illnesses. All the best in your quest! 

This game is the mobile version of the game submitted by CHSION1 of CATHOLIC HIGH SCHOOL for Singapore Games Creation Competition 2018 organised by Nanyang Polytechnic in collaboration with National Healthcare Group and ALive.

The world is teeming with disease and infection. Our surroundings are flooded with pathogenic microbes - bacterial, viral, fungal, parasitic. And they are more abundant than meets the eye. Our immune systems, our first line of defense, are often taken for granted.

In this simulated world, play as the immune system in this legendary battlefield where victory means everything - even life and death. The environment is harsh and unforgiving as all manner of horrendous pathogen attempt to infect the body and take control. It is imperative that you use the abilities of your white blood cell brethren to ensure the survival of your owner. 

Bring forth mighty white blood cells! Unleash mighty GENESIS cards! The PHENOMENA and LIFESTYLE of your owner can turn the tables in anyone's favour, but your owner's fate is in your hands! Defeat the plagues which seek to corrupt him and prove the might of the immune system!

Then, upgrade and enhance the power of your immune system by partaking in our fun and interactive minigames that seek to teach you about how to take care of yourself and increase your health.

This game is created for SGCC 2017 organised by Nanyang Polytechnic

This is a tower defense game featuring 3 themes of Recycling, Dengue prevention and Climate Change.

You are the guy who returned from dystopian future, coming to prevent the birth of biggest Enemy that the human has ever faced: Products of Human!

You have to strategize well to prevent the invasion of various enemies.
If you have any queries on the enemies or the tools to defend, be sure to check out the built-in dictionary!

You are fatman, a resident of fitville. In an effort to get fit, you decide to participate in a race. You have to dodge obstacles while choosing which type of food, healthy or unhealthy, to eat. But be careful. One wrong step might result in you losing your weight. All of it.

This game is the mobile version of the game submitted by CHSION7 of Catholic High School for Singapore Games Creation Competition 2018 organised by Nanyang Polytechnic in collaboration with National Healthcare Group and ALive.

The new MyTransport.SG mobile app now offers you with more useful travelling information and new features to help you get around Singapore. 

New features of MyTransport.SG:
• Personalisation - Quick access to your frequently used bus service and traffic information.
• My Notifications - Manage push notifications to receive MRT or Road alerts that interest you.
• Near You - View information on nearby bus services, MRT stations or traffic information in the vicinity.
• Multi-modal Journey Planner - Start planning your journey with different transport options based on your travel needs.

This application is a service of Singapore Government.

Disclaimer: Continued use of GPS running in the background may decrease battery life.

The Vendors@Gov mobile application is developed by the Accountant-General’s Department (AGD) to facilitate government vendors to manage their e-invoices and payments on the go. Vendors can now have access to the following new functions:

a. View the summary status of e-invoices and projected cashflow in easy-to-understand charts; and
b. Receive alerts on payment/rejection of e-invoices, changes in vendor account status and details, as well as broadcast messages.

The mobile application will also contain existing functions on the Vendors@Gov portal: 

a. Viewing of e-invoices and payments; 
b. Creation and submission of e-invoices; and
c. Viewing of vendor account details and updating of these records (except for bank account).

Date of official launch: 15 June 2016
To provide feedback on the application, please email us at https://app.helpdesk.agd.gov.sg/public_user/vendor/vendor/helpdesk.aspx.
By downloading, you agree to the Terms of Use and Privacy Statement of the Vendors@Gov Mobile App.

Speech to Sign Mobile application is a collaboration between Movement for the Intellectually Disabled of Singapore (MINDS) and Republic Polytechnic. This app is created mainly for workers, parents or anyone whom are interested in learning the 49 different key word signs. This app helps communication between the mentally disabled students from MINDS easier. Users of this app will be able to learn the basic sign language that is used in MINDS to help communicate easier.

Key Features:
- Convert speech to text
- Show video by speech, list selection or favorited word.
- Favourite (Add) or Delete (Remove) the word from the list of favorites
- Adjusting volume and text size throughout the application
- Audio feedback to describe how to make the hand sign.

Our Team:
Al Imran Shah Bin Hasni 
Nur Iskandar Bin Mohamed Salleh 
Lee Siao Ming

RP Connect aims to transform the way you work by using mobile technology. It connects all mobile features that simplify how Republic Polytechnic (RP) works.

For instance, we used to queue for attendance taking. With RP Connect, it allows us to take our attendance via a QR code projected on the screen and from the comfort of our seats! 

More exciting features will be made available in subsequent updates.

This application is a service of Singapore Government

About ACRA On The Go
ACRA On The Go is a mobile extension of some of the frequently used services currently available on BizFile+ - ACRA’s online business filing and information portal.

You can conduct free directory search of all the business entities registered with ACRA. This allows directors, business owners and staff of the entities, business associates, securities, research companies or consumers to conduct due diligence checks on the business entities. In addition, they can also purchase business profiles, compliance and financial profiles, or extracts via the app to get detailed information on the business entities.

You can also perform a range of filing service such renewal of business registration, change of address for Business/ LP/ LLP, transaction status enquiries and many other services while on the go.

The following services are available on the ACRA On The Go mobile app:

1. Directory Search – You can search for business related information such as UEN, business name, business status, business address, industry and year of financial statements filed.

2. iShop@ACRA – You can purchase business information products such as Business Profile, electronic certificates and extracts, etc.

3. Transaction Enquiry – You can check the status of your transaction which you have lodged with ACRA.

4. Renewal of Business/ LP and other filing services – You can do other filing services such as Change of Address for Business/ LP/ LLP, Change of FYE for Local Company, Annual Declaration Filing for LLP and Cessation of Business/ LP.

5. AGM Calculator – You can use our calculator to help you to calculate your AGM due date for local companies, annual filing due date for foreign company or annual declaration due date for LLP.

6. Ask Jamie – Our virtual assistant ‘Ask Jamie@ACRA’ will answer your queries on matter relating to ACRA.

7. ACRA Connect –You can subscribe to ACRA Connect to keep you updated on new initiatives and upcoming events. Through ACRA Connect, we also share insights into key policies and legislative changes.

Date of Official Launch: 06 November 2016 
To provide feedback on the application,
Please e-mail us at
https://www.acra.gov.sg/ask_ACRA_FAQs

MySkillsFuture is your personal guide for lifelong learning and skills upgrading and mastery. Find courses to enhance your skills, attend the latest events and workshops near you, browse bite-sized articles on the go, and access an extensive library, including articles, e-books and industry insights, to enrich yourself.

myENV app will need access to certain features on your phone for the following reasons:

• Location
Use your phone’s location to provide you with localised weather information.

• Phone
Let you call NEA hotline conveniently with just one touch.

• Photos/Media/Files
Allow you to save photographs taken with myENV app in your phone and to attach them when you file a report to NEA.

• Camera
Access the phone’s camera if you wish to attach a photograph while making a Report to NEA.

• Device ID & Call Information
Read your phone’s UUID so that you can register and receive push notifications. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Get the latest environmental news updates and information at your finger tips based on your current location with myENV:

• Access real-time information on Singapore’s weather and receive heavy rainfall alerts
• View latest air quality information
• Locate dengue clusters and improve dengue situation awareness
• Search for hawker centres by name or proximity

• Get 3R (Reduce, Reuse and Recycle) tips
• View latest NEA’s events and happenings
• Sign up as a volunteer
• Submit your feedback to NEA on your mobile device and many more!

For a full suite of information and online services, please visit http://www.nea.gov.sg or follow NEAsg on Twitter to receive more updates.

This application is a service of the Singapore Government.

LEARN is a one-stop digital learning platform that lets you learn wherever you go. It also gives you all that you need to upskill and reskill in a digital workplace.

Discover a world of learning resources with CSC’s proprietary content and curated learning pathways from renowned third-party content providers.

Sharpen your skills with personalised content according to Public Service Competency Frameworks and your learning needs.

Activate your account and LEARN today!

Note:
LEARN is best viewed on Apple phones: iOS version 11 and above, and Android phones: Android version 6 and above.

If your phone is not compatible, you can also access LEARN@Desktop via www.learn.gov.sg.

If you are downloading the app for the first time or a new Singapore public officer, please check with your HR/Training team on how to obtain a LEARN account.

Key features include:
• Food Photo recognition by snapping your food item.
• Caloric Balance dashboard to monitor your calorie intake vs output

“Find Your Friendly Buildings” mobile application is a service of the Singapore Government, brought to you by the Building and Construction Authority (BCA). It allows users to perform quick searches on the availability of user-friendly facilities in about 3,800 buildings in Singapore, while on the move.

The building details information is extracted from BCA’s Friendly Built Environment Web Portal, which was set up to create awareness on the needs to facilitate a user-friendly built environment. For more information, please visit our friendly built environment portal at www.friendlybuildings.sg.

This updated version 2 of the “Find Your Friendly Building” mobile application allows users to
• Search for >3,800 user-friendly buildings and bookmark your favourite buildings
• Check user-friendly facilities available in buildings
• Vote for the friendly buildings
• Locate and obtain barrier-free routes to the user-friendly buildings entrances from their nearest MRT stations
• Suggest alternative routes to the user-friendly buildings with image attachment and text description

This application is a service of the Singapore Government.

SG Arrival Card is an initiative from the Immigration & Checkpoints Authority (ICA), which allows foreign visitors to submit an electronic arrival card prior to their arrival in Singapore. With SG Arrival Card, visitors can perform the following services at their convenience:

- Provide personal information with ease by scanning the passport biographical data page;
- Provide a group submission for up to 10 travellers; and
- Easy retrieval of submitted records for reference.

The use of the SG Arrival Card application is free of charge. Please also note that the SG Arrival Card is NOT a visa. Visitors can visit our website at www.ica.gov.sg to check if they need a visa to enter Singapore.

[Trial]
We are conducting a trial on this mobile application. For this trial, all foreign visitors travelling to Singapore will be able to submit the electronic arrival cards except for foreign visitors arriving via cruise liners and those entering Singapore to assume work pass status.

[Who cannot participate]
A summary of foreign visitors who are NOT eligible for this trial is as follows:
- Foreigners arriving to assume work pass status 
- Passengers arriving by cruise liners

Foreign travellers who are ineligible should complete the paper-based disembarkation/embarkation cards.

ICA will study the results of this trial and progressively extend the SG Arrival Card to all foreign visitors. Kindly refer to this description for the updated list of travellers who are eligible to use the SG Arrival Card before downloading the mobile application.

This is the official BCA Green Mark application, in service of the Singapore Government. the mobile app has 4 key functionalities, namely, Ebooks, Score Calculator, the ability to import and export the score calculation, and an assistive calculator.
A useful app for CONQUAS users. Features in the app include calculator to calculate the QM scores and links to various useful websites and CONQUAS related forms.

The only official app for Sentosa, The State of Fun!

Make the most of your journey with useful, real-time information of our island resort and keep a part of Sentosa with you wherever you go

Download now and plan your trip with these features:

• Navigate your way around Sentosa with our GPS-enabled map with turn-by-turn directions

• Planning and sharing your customised itinerary with family and friends is easier than ever with our new itinerary planner

• Create your very own Sentosa photo collage and share it with family and friends!

Customs@SG is a latest service offering by Singapore Customs. 

Travellers with purchases exceeding their personal duty free concession or Goods & Services Tax (GST) relief can use the app to declare and pay the duty and/or GST for the goods purchased, anytime anywhere prior to their arrival in Singapore. 

The app also allows members of the public to provide timely tip-off on customs offences, feedback or send enquiries relating to Customs matters. 

With Customs@SG, you can easily access the following services at your fingertips: 

- Declare and pay duty and/or GST on your overseas purchases
- Provide tip-offs on customs offences
- Provide feedback on customs matters

This application is a service of Singapore Government.

eAppt@ICA is the latest initiative from the Immigration & Checkpoints Authority (ICA), which allows members of public to book an appointment with ICA to complete their application processes as well as to change or cancel appointments. With eAppt@ICA, everyone will have the following services at their fingertips:

1) Book appointments* with all 3 Services Centres of ICA.
2) View existing appointments* made with ICA at 'My Appointment' tab.
3) Locate SingPost outlets for alternate site collection of selected ICA documents and passes.
4) Links to other Home Team Departments' homepage. 

Note:
-*Selected services may require you to log in with your SingPass ID before booking an appointment 
- For any enquiries, please email us at ICA_Feedback@ica.gov.sg

Take charge of your health with HealthHub Track. Achieve your health goals with our suite of tools, action plans, and healthy lifestyle guides, specially designed for Singaporeans.

Simply sign up for a HealthHub account and choose a health goal:

Live Healthy
Prevent Diabetes
Living with Diabetes
Quit Smoking
Healthy Pregnancy

Connect with over 100 popular health and activity trackers such as Healthy 365, Fitbit, Nokia Health, Garmin, S Health, Google Fit and more. Once connected, you will receive regular health tips and insights on the activities you do every day and learn how they impact your health.

Start your personal health journey with HealthHub Track today.

The hiSG mobile application is brought to you by the Health Promotion Board (HPB), exclusively for participants of the Health Insights Singapore (hiSG) study. The hiSG mobile app is designed to provide hiSG participants with a more seamless and engaging study experience by allowing them to respond directly to study questionnaires on the app and log their meals taken via the app’s meal logging tool. Participants are also able to track their progress in the study, earn Healthpoints for participation in study activities, as well as gain deeper insights on their health via the app.

Healthy 365 mobile app is brought to you by the Health Promotion Board (HPB).
This app enables you to track your daily steps count and calculate the corresponding calories burned as you move. Among other tracking sources, you can use Samsung Health to track steps. With a compatible wearable that tracks heart rate, you can also track the duration engaged in higher intensity physical activities. Steps and heart rate data from Samsung Health can be shared with Healthy 365 mobile app while participating in Health Challenges.


Key features include:
• Dashboard that provide you with an overview of your fitness, Healthpoints and rewards information.
• Health Challenges that enable you to step up to get healthy, earn Healthpoints and redeem rewards
• New Eat Drink Shop Healthy Challenge digital passport with more rewards that can be earned along with Healthpoints when you make healthier purchases
• History charts to keep records of your past steps count, heart rate, distance covered and calorie intake and output 
• Healthpoints history function that allows tracking of your scans from healthier food, drink or grocery consumption
• Nearby listing and map views on HPB events, healthier eateries, exercise facilities and routes in your vicinity
• Integration with new HPB steps trackers and exercise apps including Actxa® and Fitbit® 
• Sync for Friends function to allow both non-smartphone and smartphone participants to conveniently sync their steps on their friend or family member’s smartphone
• Background location detection of nearby Scan&Win Hotspots for earning Healthpoints

Note:
• This app uses background location for detection of outdoor Hotspots
• Continued use of GPS running in the background may dramatically decrease battery life
• For the optimum experience, please ensure that your phone is set to Singapore Time zone (GMT +8)
• For any enquiries, please call our hotline at 1800 567 2020 or email us at stepschallenge@hpb.gov.sg

One-stop access to health records of your family, friends, children. Learn, manage and improve your health, schedule your appointments, check your personal health records, access your immunisation, screening and lab test results, view your child’s upcoming immunisation schedule and more*!

HealthHub is your personal digital health companion by the Ministry of Health and Health Promotion Board Singapore.

Features:

• Appointments: Make, view, reschedule, cancel
• Medications: Access your prescription records and medication lists
• Refill: Request for medication refill or renewal of prescription
• Payments: Pay for your medical bills
• Admissions (Financial Counselling): View your estimated cost, change ward type, make online payment for deposit
• Children Health: Track your child’s developmental milestones and vaccination records as well as upcoming immunisation schedule
• Family Health: View your parents’ medical appointments and medication lists
• School Health: Get notified of school health assessments and your child’s referral letters
• Directory Listing: Find doctors, caregivers, 24 hour CHAS clinics easily
• Healthpoints: Be rewarded when you complete quizzes

* Participating restructured hospitals, polyclinics and specialist outpatient clinics from the public healthcare sector.

CPF e-Submit@mobile is a free tool provided by the CPF Board for employers to conveniently e-submit and pay their monthly CPF contributions on-the-go. It is optimised for mobile devices to help employers complete their submissions easily and quickly. It is most suitable for employers with 10 or fewer employees.

Benefits of using CPF e-Submit@mobile:
a) No pre-registration required
b) Fuss-free submission of your CPF contribution details via any mobile platform
c) Mobile optimised screen for positive user experience
d) Secure payment via:
• eNETS [personal bank accounts from DBS, POSB, UOB, OCBC, Citibank (Maxisave / Ready Credit) and Standard Chartered are accepted]; or
• OCBC Bank ATM / Internet Banking using the Transaction Reference Number (TRN) generated

This application is a service of the Singapore Government.

Get the latest updates on flash floods from CCTV images with PUB’s MyWaters app. Informative content on beautiful waterscapes are also available at your fingertips.

About PUB
National water agency, PUB is a statutory board under the Ministry of the Environment and Water Resources. It is the water agency that manages Singapore’s water supply, water catchment and used water in an integrated way. For more information, visit www.pub.gov.sg or www.facebook.com/PUBsg.

This application is a service of the Singapore Government.

Events easily helps you in managing invites, RSVP and attendance.

This application is a service of the Singapore Government.

The "Events" is a simple to use mobile application that allow staffs to organize official and casual corporate activities within the organization.

With technology at our finger tips, we are making it easier to collaborate and increase in productivity by eliminating administrative work such as collating RSVP and attendance on paper. Imagine when your invitees list is long and tracking the change of status is a pain.

Events in its alpha stage now, lies a great opportunities ahead in incorporating more services and functionalities that could bring the collaboration and productivity to a new level. Join us and help us to grow.

This is a story. But this story isn't about you.
This story is about your brother, Clint. Lately, Clint has been hiding in his room more often. This has been unnatural of him, since he used to more social – going out often, playing with his friends, etc. He doesn't act normal at all and you suspect his emotional health is at stake.
One day you find a calendar hung on the wall of his room. On it was marked 24th July. What could it mean? What will happen on that day? Nothing good may come out of it, so you may think.
As a responsible brother, you need to get to the bottom of this and help him!

Tired of managing travel claims and receipts? Look no further! My HR Kiosk makes capturing receipts, tracking trip distance and time quick, easy and hassle free. 
Features: 

1. Create travel expenses anytime, anywhere: 
• Option to create your expense during or after your trip.
• Choose your mode of transport and log in your trip start and end locations and you are done!

2. Submit your claims with just a click:

Write a review, share your experience and help us improve our app. Start claiming on the move now! .

CorpPass is the required login method for online transactions with the government. First launched for Singapore-registered business entities and SingPass-backed users, it is now available for foreigners who need to transact with the Singapore government.

Enjoy the following benefits with CorpPass.

• Enhanced data protection for businesses and employees, with separate login IDs for corporate and personal matters

• Increased convenience to transact with multiple government agencies, with each user having a single corporate digital identity and no longer handling multiple login IDs for different services.

• Better internal control within businesses, as key personnel can grant and manage employees access to each government digital service.

For more information, visit www.corppass.gov.sg/corppass/common/findoutmore > Foreign Registered Entities Tab.

Digital Workplace is an initiative to improve the day-to-day working experiences through user-centric digital tools and solutions. 

In this version, you will be able to view your upcoming activities in the calendar. Also, easily make a room booking as well!

Feel free to contact us if you have any feedback or suggestions.

The Moments of Life app is a Smart Nation initiative providing a one-stop, convenient platform for citizens to access personalised government services and information at key life moments.

The app features services and information for (a) seniors aged 60 and above, as well as (b) parents and caregivers of young children.

Key features for seniors aged 60 and above:
- Access their Merdeka Generation e-card;
- Find out the latest active ageing programmes near them; and
- Check the government benefits that they are eligible for.

Key features for parents and caregivers of young children:
- Access to 3-in-1 birth registration service - register birth, apply for Baby Bonus and activate child library membership; - Access to child’s medical appointments and immunisation records;
- Conduct geolocation search and indicate interest for pre-schools; and;
- Look out for parenting information and family-friendly event listings.

If you have any feedback or would like to share your experience using this application, please contact us through the app under Help and Support.

This app is optimised for Android 5.0 and above.

Calculate parking fees automatically
Key in your vehicle number, select the car park and indicate your estimated parking duration. Your charges will be automatically calculated (free parking timings, whole-day parking, night parking are all included).

Pay for parking digitally
Pay using your credit or debit card and start parking.

Track and extend your parking session remotely
Receive notifications when your parking session is expiring or has ended. Extend your parking session without having to return to your vehicle.

End your parking session early
End your parking session if you're back at your vehicle early. A refund based on the actual parked duration will be given.

Known Issues:
* Confirmation screen gets partially cut-off on the HTC U11 and HTC 10 because of HTC Boost+ app optimisation. Turn off the Boost+ app optimisation for the app and it will work.
* Delayed notifications on China brand phones like Xiaomi, Huawei, Oppo. This is due to their aggressive battery optimisation. Add the app to the Protected Apps list to solve the delayed notifications issue.

Log in within seconds using your fingerprint or 6-digit passcode.

KEY FEATURES

- View your government-verified data in one place

With the new MyInfo Profile feature, customize the data you want to see. Choose from your passport expiry date, CPF account information, HDB property, and more.

- Say goodbye to long passwords

You don’t have to enter your SingPass ID or password anymore. With QR Login. simply scan or tap the QR code to launch the app, verify and you’re in! You can also launch commonly-used digital services directly from the app with our Login Shortcut feature.

- Transact securely on-the-go

Going for a holiday or staying overseas? Enjoy greater mobility when you use the new SingPass Mobile app. No more waiting for SMS OTP, or carrying a token around!

SET UP IN 3 EASY STEPS

To set up, all you need is a smartphone, an internet connection, and a registered SingPass account.

- Step 1: Install SingPass Mobile by clicking the button above.

- Step 2: Complete a one-time set up.

- Step 3: You’re all set. Log in to government digital services using your fingerprint or 6-digit passcode – it’s that simple!

FEEDBACK

We want to hear from you! For any feedback or questions, please email us at support@singpass.gov.sg.

Note: SingPass Mobile can only be installed on one device at a time.

This application is brought to you by the Government Technology Agency of Singapore.

APP PERMISSIONS

In order to provide the service, the app requires certain permissions.

[Mandatory]
“Phone”: This permission is used to obtain your device’s IMEI, among other parameters, to secure the app and generate a unique ID to tag the app to your device.

[Mandatory]
“Storage”, may also be known as “Photos, media and files”: This permission allows the app to obtain additional parameters from the device storage hardware as one of the factors in deriving the unique ID for enhanced security. A file is also created on your storage to save your troubleshooting ID when logs are sent to our Helpdesk.

The following requirements are recommended for an optimised user experience:

- Minimum Android version 4.4
- At least 100MB storage space
- Google Play services installed

COMMON ISSUES

If you’re encountering a “settings altered” prompt, it may be due to a rooted device. Certain apps that provide fake GPS or remote administration functions may also cause the prompt to be shown. While the team is continuously assessing these apps, users may choose to uninstall such apps to use SingPass Mobile.

If you’re encountering a “request expired” prompt, try setting your device to use “Automatic Date & Time” or “Automatic Timezone”. The exact name may differ according to your device, and can be found in your device settings.

Enjoy fast, free and easy access to Singapore official statistics and key ASEAN statistics with the SingStat Mobile App. View the data in chart and tabular formats spanning across 28 data categories, including GDP, Population, Prices, Labour, Manufacturing, Services and International Trade.

The app provides you with the latest information on Singapore's key economic and socio-demographic indicators at your fingertips. The app also allows you to bookmark your favourite indicators for quick access via My Bookmarks page, personalise the order of data categories, subscribe to push notifications to receive the latest data updates, perform quick analyses with the computation function and share charts and data tables via social media platforms.

For more information, please visit https://www.singstat.gov.sg/our-services-and-tools/singstat-mobile-app. 

The mobile application is designed for devices with Android OS 4.4 and above.

Download the one-north Mobile App today!"

"Report-a-Fault" is a mobile application that provides a convenient channel for reporting issues (e.g. Cleaniness, Defects, etc) of properties under JTC. Users will take photos of defects, select the specific JTC property based on location, input short descriptions and feedback submission would be routed to JTC Officers instantly.

Take Photos, Select JTC Property Location, Submit Fault Reports and be routed to JTC Officer instantly.

Keywords: JTC, JTC Corporation, Report-a-Fault, Feedbacks, JTC Officers, JTC Feedback, report a fault, jurong town corporation
MASConnect allows you to book rooms and much more.

The Careers@Gov mobile application allows you to browse & apply for jobs in the Singapore Public Service.

The Singapore Public Service employs about 140,000 public officers working in 16 ministries and more than 50 statutory boards. If you have a passion to serve the people, and want a meaningful career – come join us!

The Singapore Public Service : Integrity . Service . Excellence

For more information, visit our website at www.careers.gov.sg

The SingHealth eLearning app empowers learning on-the-go. Through the app, users stay connected to the eLearning portal and have easy access to course content or learning activities anytime, anywhere. 

The app is easy to use and provides accessibility to learning resources at the fingertips!

Note: App only works with Android 5.0 (Lollipop) or Higher.

eLEARN LMS app is a mobile application for staff from the National Healthcare Group, JurongHealth and Alexandra Health System. It complements the main learning portal - elearn.sg by providing staff with easy access to learning resources and online participation.

Businesses can now use this customized merchant app to accept payments from their customers using ActiveWallet in the ActiveSG app. Customers will make payment by scanning QR codes and other online mechanisms. Through this app, Business partners can be notified of the payments in real-time, view past transactions and other operations.

ActiveSG

Download this free mobile app and start exploring sports and activity venues located throughout Singapore. Designed for smartphone users to make searches, reservations, registrations, purchases and quick payments, all in one convenient, feature-rich app. Real-time access to all facilities and programmes made available to the public by Sport Singapore. 


Key features:

All user types
Registered users. Verified members. Supplementary (family) accounts. Junior (under-16) members. All can use ActiveSG with varying privileges. 

Smart search 
Search for a sports facility nearby, view its location and check its amenities. Ask the app to recommend best possible venues for your interests.

End-to-end booking
Venue, date and time selection. Course registrations. Event sign-ups. Shopping cart with options for add-on items. Payments, cancellations and refunds.

One-touch booking
The app remembers all your previous bookings so you can grab your favourite slots the next time round. No need to retrace your steps.

Virtual ID
Check in and check out of a swim or gym facility, by scanning the QR code on your mobile phone screen (after buying an entry pass).

Tags : ActiveSG, ActiveWallet, Active SG, Active Wallet, Sport Singapore, Sports, Swim, Gym, Facilities Booking, Programmes, iAPPS

SP Mobile is a Singapore Polytechnic (SP) mobile application. Established in 1954, SP is Singapore’s first polytechnic. SP offers full-time diploma courses and a wide range of continuing education programmes to its students. SP alumni includes successful entrepreneurs, well-known professionals, and leaders in government.

SP Mobile provides a single point access to commonly used tools for students and staff in SP to learn and work. Some features are also available to public. The app can be personalised by customising favourite apps list on the home page to easily access the frequently used features.


Note : SP Mobile is supported in the two latest Android versions. Upgrade to the latest Android version in order to enjoy the full features on SP Mobile.

IMPORTANT: This is not the full-feature version. Additional features will be included in stages in subsequent releases.

Life.

With Active Health Labs being rolled out island-wide managed by qualified Active Health Experts, an Active Health app to keep track of your fitness progress, and fun community activities, it’s never been easier to proactively own your health.

Let’s all live life to the fullest.

And remember, #betterbeatsperfect

The Urban Redevelopment Authority ("URA") provides comprehensive and timely real estate information to enhance the transparency of the Singapore property market and to facilitate developers, property owners and the general public in making informed decisions on land development, property investment/purchases and leasing.

This application includes information on sale prices and rentals of private residential properties in Singapore (including prices of units sold by developers).

Whilst every reasonable endeavour has been made to ensure that the contents of the Property Market Information are accurate and complete, the URA does not warrant the accuracy, correctness and completeness of such contents and shall not be responsible for any injury, loss or damage whatsoever may arise as a result of any use of or reliance on such contents.

PALMS is a one-stop mobile learning management platform for grassroots volunteers of the People's Association. The app allows you to access interactive e-Learning courseware with your mobile devices at your convenience.

NACLI will continue to introduce new features and new e-contents to upskill and enable you to better serve the community.

Download PALMS today!

MindWorks is a set of brain training games designed for older adults. These games were developed by researchers from the Centre for Applied Gerontology and students from Temasek Polytechnic (Singapore), in collaboration with renowned neuroscientist Professor Ryuta Kawashima from Tohoku University (Japan). 

There are 6 games which involve memory, attention, logic and arithmetic calculation. Through our research and testing, the results have shown that these games could activate the brain’s prefrontal areas of older adults during gameplay. The prefrontal cortex (PFC) of the brain is responsible for executive functions such as decision-making and problem-solving. Studies have shown that activation of the PFC could potentially improve cognitive performance and function. 

Upon completion of each game, the player will be provided feedback on his/her performance through the comparison with other players’ scores in the same age group. On-going research will be conducted to validate the cognitive effects of these games in improving cognitive abilities for daily life activities in older adults.
